author: Staff Reporter
text:
District Election Officer and Collector Archana Patnaik on Saturday asked all political parties to observe the Model Code of Conduct (MCC) in letter and spirit.

Addressing a meeting of political parties’ representatives at the collectorate she said that the parties should stick to the time schedule the Election Commission had recommended, said a release from the district administration.

It said that the Collector had asked the parties to confine their campaign between 6 a.m. and 10 p.m., maintain accounts of expenditure as recommended by the Commission and not indulge in actions that would be in violation of the code like sticking bills or erecting hoardings.

Sources, who participated in the meeting, said that the political parties had wanted extension of the campaign time till 11 p.m. and relaxation regarding erection and use of flag poles.

In the run up to the last election, the district administration had either removed or covered those poles.

The DMK wanted to know if authorities concerned would accept nominations on Saturdays.

Another party sought clarification on dress to be worn during polling – if dress representing party symbols or flags could be used.

Even as the discussion went on, officials’ in-charge of imposing the MCC went around the city and other parts of the district removing hoardings.

In the Coimbatore Corporation limits, the Town Planning team was busy removing hoardings.

Sources in the civic body said that the job of whitewashing walls to remove political party symbols and leaders’ names would begin on Monday.

Even private buildings would not be spared, the officials said.
title: Follow model code of conduct: Collector
